intro: Aiouea areolata, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are alternate, ovate, and have a rough texture with prominent veins. Aiouea areolata is well adapted to the tropical climate of Hawaii and is often found in coastal and lowland areas.
